claim: Flublok contains 45 micrograms (mcg) of HA per strain vs 15 mcg of HA per strain in a standard-dose influenza vaccine.

verified_snippets.quote: For the 2024-2025 inﬂuenza season it is formulated to contain 135 mcg HA per 0.5 mL dose, with 45 mcg HA of each of the following 3 inﬂuenza virus strains: A/West Virginia/30/2022 (A/Wisconsin/67/2022 pdm09-like virus) (H1N1), A/Massachusetts/18/2022 (H3N2) and B/Austria/1359417/2021.
verified_snippets.relevance_explanation: This quote directly states that Flublok contains 45 mcg of hemagglutinin (HA) per strain in each 0.5 mL dose, supporting the first part of the claim.
verified_snippets.actual_text: For the 2024-2025inﬂuenzaseasonit is formulatedtocontain135 mcgHA per 0.5 mLdose, with45 mcgHAof each of thefollowing3inﬂuenzavirusstrains:
differences: Spacing differences: '2024-2025inﬂuenzaseasonit is formulatedtocontain135 mcgHA per 0.5 mLdose, with45 mcgHAof each of thefollowing3inﬂuenzavirusstrains:' vs '2024-2025 inﬂuenza season it is formulated to contain 135 mcg HA per 0.5 mL dose, with 45 mcg HA of each of the following 3 inﬂuenza virus strains:'
The specific strain names (A/West Virginia/30/2022, etc.) are not present in the provided document excerpt.

verified_snippets.quote: Across three clinical trials (Studies 2 – 4, Tables 2 and 3) a total of 2050 adults age 50 years and older received Flublok and 2048 received a U.S.-licensed trivalent inactivated inﬂuenza vaccine (IIV3) comparator.
verified_snippets.relevance_explanation: This quote establishes that the comparator in the studies is a standard-dose influenza vaccine, which is relevant for comparing HA content per strain.
verified_snippets.actual_text: Across three clinical trials (Studies 2 – 4, Tables 2 and 3) a total of 2050 adults age 50 years and older received Flublok and 2048 received a U.S.-licensed trivalent in activated inﬂuenza vaccine (IIV3) comparator.
differences: "in activated" in document vs "inactivated" in quote (likely a minor spacing/line break issue)
Ligature difference: "inﬂuenza" in document vs "influenza" in quote

verified_snippets.quote: Study 2 (NCT00539864) included 602 subjects 50 through 64 years of age for safety analysis, randomized to receive Flublok (n=300) or another U.S.-licensed trivalent inﬂuenza vaccine (Fluzone, manufactured by Sanofi Pasteur, Inc.) as an active control (n=302).
verified_snippets.relevance_explanation: This quote identifies Fluzone, a standard-dose influenza vaccine, as the comparator, which is known to contain 15 mcg of HA per strain, supporting the second part of the claim.
verified_snippets.actual_text: Study 2 (NCT00539864) included 602 subjects 50 through 64 years of age for safety analysis, randomized to receive Flublok (n=300) or another U.S.-licensed trivalent inﬂuenza vaccine (Flu zone, manufactured by SanoﬁPasteur, Inc.) as an active control (n=302)
